title: Related rate problem of a sphere

content.question:
The volume of a sphere is decreasing at a constant rate of 3 cubic centimeters per second. At the instant when the radius of the sphere is decreasing at a rate of 0.25 centimeter per second, what is the radius of the sphere?

(The volume V of a sphere with radius r is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mn>4</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mi>Ï€</mi><msup> <mi>r</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. )

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
